summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 regarding the coordination of discovery materials (specifically witness interview notes/reports, or "1As") for case 31E-MM-108062, which is related to the Epstein investigation. The emails are between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), a contractor, and an FBI Special Agent, discussing the need to locate, verify dates for, and produce specific files from four disks to meet an upcoming production deadline.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.role: Person from whom notes may be requested
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential source for obtaining original interview notes if they are missing from the current production set.

persons.name: Paul
persons.role: Person from whom notes may be requested
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Mandy as a potential source for obtaining original interview notes if they are missing from the current production set.

persons.name: Sunny
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding checking a spreadsheet of witness interview notes against materials produced or to be produced.

persons.name: Annie
persons.context: Addressed alongside Sunny in an email regarding checking a spreadsheet of witness interview notes against materials produced or to be produced.

connections.description: Both are mentioned together as individuals who may be asked to provide original interview notes for the case production.

events.title: Request for 1A File Verification
events.description: An email is sent requesting a team to check a spreadsheet of witness interview notes (1As) against materials produced or to be produced for discovery (3500 material).

events.title: Coordination for File Retrieval
events.description: Email chain continues with coordination to pull 44 specific files listed in a spreadsheet, with a request to receive them within the next few days to meet an upcoming production deadline.

keyFacts: The communication pertains to case 31E-MM-108062, which is an Epstein-related investigation handled by the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking desk in New York.
The core task is verifying and producing "1As" (witness interview notes/reports) from four specific disks as part of discovery (3500 material).
There is an urgent production deadline driving the request, with a need to obtain files "tomorrow or in the next few days."
The document reveals procedural coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, a contractor, and the FBI regarding evidence management years after Epstein's death.
